A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Honestly\, this  movie made me love again the old times of George Lucas and the whole prequel saga. I was always a big Star Wars Fan and I was\, actually\, keen on seeing this flick. However\, I came out lectured on gender politics and animal abuse and the rich eating the poor... what the heck went SO WRONG? Why has it to be SO progressive-political? Some scenes were outright embarrassing. I truely felt cheated on Luke Skywalker after the heavy build up in TFA... but it does not stop there. There was a drop of climax everywhere imaginable. Biggest of all: the end of Snoke/Phasma. What was Phasma about anyway?!? I never thought I would say that\, since I was a child but... I am honestly not interested in this franchise anymore. After all old charaters died I do not feel enough attached to Mary Sue Rey or Finn or the rest of the bunch I don't even remember the names of. I have no interest in the next installment anymore. Happy hyping.
